column4: why does ubuntu make a 1.5gb swap partition using the default automatic partitioning , resulting in low performance after booting in the new system.. i have 512ram and it does a 1.5gb swap if i leave it by itself.. and then ubuntu works slower than normal
if ubuntu works 'slower than normal', it is not because of the size of the swap partition.
your Linux books are seriously outdated
see if you have a CPU hog. Run top and observe the top three or four lines for a while
